channel.title: BMS Translate is down, what now?
channel.description:
So the original forum of Black Mesa Translate is down [url=https://bmtranslate.forumsplace.com/index.php]Link here[/url] and I was wondering, did you found a new site already because it's hard to contact any of those guys because I don't know there names on this forum as well as there steam ID's.
We knew that BMTranslate would go down so we did already saved most of the translations, don't worry about that.
....FAQ: Yes that website is down for ever and no they will not put it back online anymore.

item.title: BMS Translate is down, what now?
item.dc:creator: MysticJ
item.description:
Siggs:

What is this, people hating on the translations? What are you trying to do, stop certain people enjoying the game?

Even intelligent people tend to go through the phase in their lives when they think “Why can’t everybody just learn English and let’s drop all other languages”.

Even people who are perfect in English would have trouble understanding Mossman when she talked about “Tau-Yamaho” (I personally heard “tau-yau model” the first time around) or when Kleiner mentioned “orbifold, Hilbert-inclusive”.

Then you have the group of hearing-impaired people, who can’t do without subtitles.

People just don’t have anything better to do now, they feel malnutritioned with information (or lack thereof), so they poke into totally minor areas of the mod, trying to find something good to kill time.

Read full topic
item.source: BMS Translate is down, what now?

item.title: BMS Translate is down, what now?
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
Raminator:

Well, besides the bit where Landa investigates LaPadite’s farm. Although it served the plot really well it was a bit of a deus ex machina moment, most of the cinema laughed out loud when Colonel Landa asked if they could switch to English.

Well yeah, but it’s not like they were speaking English in the movie while they were supposed to be speaking German in reality, like they do in many movies.

Read full topic

item.title: BMS Translate is down, what now?
item.dc:creator: Siggs
item.description:
What is this, people hating on the translations? What are you trying to do, stop certain people enjoying the game?

You may not need them, no reason to complain about them.

item.source: BMS Translate is down, what now?

item.title: BMS Translate is down, what now?
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
Dillxn:

Um, I beg to differ. I hate games / movies / etc, that place you in another country and then have all English speaking characters. That’s basically why I didn’t watch Inglorious Basterds (I heard they didn’t speak German throughout).

You were sadly misinformed. They speak German or French where appropriate. If I remember correctly at least.

Read full topic
item.source: BMS Translate is down, what now?

item.title: BMS Translate is down, what now?
item.dc:creator: russilker
item.description:
Yes.

I understand english perfectly well, and I enjoy video game immersion, but I ALWAYS turn on FULL subtitles. That includes in-game SFX, speech, etc. I can’t stand missing a word of dialogue, and it makes the experience seem more cinematic for me.

Read full topic
item.source: BMS Translate is down, what now?

item.title: BMS Translate is down, what now?
item.dc:creator: Imonfire
item.description:
sersoft:

Yes it would, why do you ask?

oh u

Dillxn:

Um, I beg to differ. I hate games / movies / etc, that place you in another country and then have all English speaking characters. That’s basically why I didn’t watch Inglorious Basterds (I heard they didn’t speak German throughout).

So you would have liked a movie entirely in german (with French parts) subtitled in English?

item.title: BMS Translate is down, what now?
item.dc:creator: TheOneAndOnly
item.description:
I guess you do have a point, but still, as I said this is more of a service for people who don’t know English/simply prefer subtitles. As simple as that

Now, I’ve put this together. It may not be so cool as the other one, but I guess it works

item.title: BMS Translate is down, what now?
item.dc:creator: Dillxn
item.description:
Imonfire:

Sometimes Gameplay > Realism. Wouldn’t be too fun if everyone in S.T.A.L.K.E.R. spoke Russian, don’t you think?

Um, I beg to differ. I hate games / movies / etc, that place you in another country and then have all English speaking characters. That’s basically why I didn’t watch Inglorious Basterds (I heard they didn’t speak German throughout).

item.title: BMS Translate is down, what now?
item.dc:creator: PingWing
item.description:
(that above) And not everybody’s English is perfect.

And If you ask me, we did made lots of progress but we just don’t have enough people for all the languages (If somebody on this forum finds people from another country - ask them or they want to translate for BMS).

And Hubicorn - “forumplace” went down because they didn’t had enough money to keep it up also they had a lot of spammers (also a problem on BMStranslate).

Read full topic
item.source: BMS Translate is down, what now?

item.title: BMS Translate is down, what now?
item.dc:creator: Coolm4n
item.description:
mattemuse:

It’s more realistic in English anyway. The game takes place in an English speaking country, everyone speaks English, just take in the whole experience as if you are “immersed” in this English-speaking environment. Subtitles ruin immersion so just roll with it IMHO.

Subtitles doesn’t ruin much the immersion. DUBBING DOES.

Read full topic

item.title: BMS Translate is down, what now?
item.dc:creator: TheOneAndOnly
item.description:
Well, I’m honestly not sure. Vidanor has been kinda MIA, so perhaps I’ll look for a place somewhere to create a new forum. I didn’t see much progress during the time the other forum was up though, but I’m hoping things are gonna work out now that we’re getting close to the release date (or are we? )

But yeah, I’ll look around for a place, if Vidanor doesn’t beat me to it.

Read full topic
